text: WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus stressed that worries over soaring energy prices, due in part to Russia's invasion of Ukraine, should help propel change.

altTexts.text:
- The head of [Organization:WHO], [Person:Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus], emphasized that concerns about the escalating energy costs, partly attributed to the invasion of [Location:Russia] into [Location:Ukraine], ought to drive the need for transformation.
- [Person:Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus], the leader of [Organization:WHO], underlined the significance of apprehensions regarding the surging energy prices, which are partially linked to the invasion of [Location:Russia] into [Location:Ukraine], in catalyzing change.
- Stressing the impact of the invasion of [Location:Russia] into [Location:Ukraine], [Person:Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus], the head of [Organization:WHO], highlighted the connection between these events and the mounting energy prices, calling for transformative action.
- The invasion of [Location:Ukraine] by [Location:Russia] has contributed to the skyrocketing energy prices, and [Person:Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus], the chief of [Organization:WHO], emphasized that this should serve as a driving force for change.
- [Person:Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus], the chief of [Organization:WHO], stressed that the concerns surrounding the exorbitant energy prices, partly caused by [Location:Russia]'s invasion of [Location:Ukraine], should motivate transformative measures.
